reviews.review_text: Amazing experience! I visited this restaurant for the first time and it was excellent. The Japanese energy is fantastic, the server was super friendly, kind and helpful. The food was delicious huge portions, I even took some home. If you are celebrating your birthday, they give you a dessert and a Polaroid picture as a suvenir. The coctails are wonderful and everything is served in a super creative way! I will come back soon!!!

The best Japanese restaurant I ever tried in Vancouver. Service is professional and patience. Food is amazing. Fresh ingredients and yummy miso soup. I found they will serve the fresh washibi instead of the manufactured one!!! That s a great surprise!!! All the environment let you feel like you re in Japan. If you celebrate your anniversary or birthday, they will offer a complimentary pudding and sing a special song for you. It will be my number one if I want to enjoy the Japanese food. Definitely will let all my friends know and highly recommend if you want to try . Just in case, please remember to make your reservation.

Raisu is an excellent Japanese restaurant with delicious food. Their drinks are very reasonably priced with my favorite being the Naminooto Kabosukkiri Fruit Sake. The Chicken Karaage and Garlic Edamame were some of my favorites. It was a bit hot in the section where you take your shoes off when we went but theyre great for special events (very entertaining birthday singing with a tamberine and free polaroid of everyone).

Uni omakase was great and sooo worth the money. Amazing value for money. The appetizer was the best. Acidic, good uni flavour, truffle jelly. Amazing combination. Sashimi and maki was great. Lots of fresh fat uni. Uni egg custard was soft and thick flavoured. Uni stone rice was better with the soup but salty.

We were here for a friend birthday. Reservation was done online.The staff kindly asked for food allergy and which person with allergy in email after registration. When we arrived, we were sat at the patio table where it is bright and breeze, very comfy. I was impressed with how attentive staff were. Water jug gets fill whenever close to empty, they remembered which member has food allergy and let the person know as we order. For the great taste, good portion and amazing service, the price point is justified in my opinion. The birthday star got a birthday song, dessert and polaroid photo from the staff. Totally made the day. Thank you for making this visit so so special. Vegetarian options: There is menu Wheelchair accessibility: Not wheelchair friendly as the Restaurant is on second floor.

We came to celebrate a special occasion and we had such an amazing dinner! We ordered the wagyu course for three and every dish was delicious. The staff was so attentive and friendly too! She made sure that we had no food allergies to the course menu at the start of our dinner, and the staff including in an almond jelly dessert for our celebration. Thank you Raisu for making our last dinner in Vancouver (we are just visiting) so wonderful!

Some of the best vegan Japanese I ve had outside of Japan. Felt like an izakaya. Cozy, busy, stylish with artful dishes. The moment I arrived the staff were gracious. Seated in a spot out of the way along the counter so it was a bit calmer. I pre ordered the vegan bento box (you have to call ahead at least 24 hours so they can prepare the bento boxes). They went above and beyond to verify whether I had any food allergies and anyone who served me was aware of my request. They work incredibly well as a team. Ordered a jasmine tea which is in the form of a blooming tea...this was a nice surprise to receive most places only use dried flower. The vegan bento box is like a meticulous work of art. Each dish highlighted different ingredients and flavours true to the style of dish. It is served with rice and a rich almost creamy miso soup (best I ve ever had). Vegetarian options: Vegan bento box

This is definitely one of the highest quality sushi restaurants in Vancouver. The price of each meal may not appeal to everyone. However, if I ever wanted to share a solid sushi meal with someone new in town or maybe even a business meal, I would definitely bring them here. I came here with my wife and kids and the service was excellent. The toro is some of the best I ve ever had. This may not be a place that I d come back to often simply due to affordability, however, If I ever want to celebrate and enjoy high quality sushi, I will come back for sure.

It s a pretty fantastic Japanese restaurant that focuses on high quality ingredients. We had a large party so we had to put in the order ahead of time. The atmosphere was really nice and the staff were busy but still friendly. I had the deluxe seafood bowl which was not cheap but the ingredients and the quality of the overall food made it feel like it was worth the hefty price tag. Other food was generally delicious but if you want the best bang for your buck, I would suggest the katsu. The cocktails were also quite tasty. I had the yuzu flavoured drink with the yuzu infused ice cream which was perfect on the hot summer evening. I highly recommend this place for any occasion, but especially birthdays because it seemed like almost every other table was celebrating their birthday. I know this because the staff would come up and sing you a song with a nice dessert. Overall I had a great experience and would come again to try other menu items!

Great quality sushi and sashimi! We tried the shokado Bento which you have to pre-order, but I probably wouldnt get that again as we didnt enjoy some of the 9 items. It was good to try out what they had, but next time we will just order more of what we like.

I really enjoyed celebrating my birthday at Raisu. The staff sings and provides a delicious free dessert at the end. You also receive a cute picture. While not cheap, the food is pretty good and I would recommend it!

Chicken kaarage was very good, one of the best Ive had, big pieces, very juicy and lots of flavour. Wagyu beef udon was tasty and spicy miso was great. More expensive but the portion sizes are huge! And all the food we got was great. The chirashi bowl was fresh and big portion. Staff were very friendly. Is often busy so you should make a reservation ahead of time.

Tonight we celebrated our anniversary at RAISU. We decided to order the Omakase Uni Zakushi Lunch Set, the Omakase Aburi Set and the Salted Plum Sour to drink. The Uni Lunch Set for 2 was more than enough and we couldve realistically done without the Aburi but there were no regrets with the additional order. Without any doubts everything was delicious. What made our experience exceptional was our kind server, Momo (Peach). She provided an excellent recommendation when we couldnt decide on what to order and checked up on us regularly providing the next dish as well finished ours. She made us laugh and towards the  end of our meal she took a photo of us, giving us a copy to commemorate the occasion. Overall the food was amazing and the service was 5/5. Well definitely recommend the restaurant to our friends and family
First time visited Raisu with friends for lunch, oh my god, sensational. The staff are very kind, the food is definitely high quality. We totally had a good time at Raisu today.

We were after their uni dishes so when found out it was not available that day, we were very disappointed. We ended up ordering two sushi dishes and three meat dishes. We actually liked those three meat dishes (steak on garlic rice, hamburg teishoku, and menchi-katsu) better than the sushi. They were all juicy and tasty, probably the best we had ever had in town. We left very full, happy, and satisfied. We look forward to coming back for more good surprises! Excellent service staff were all genuinely nice!

If i compare it with all Japanese restaurant in town, it is absolutely on the top 1%.  But honestly i won t say it is good if i compare it among good Japanese restaurant around the world.  A bit disappointed on my first visit. Still a nice to have in Vancouver as we don t have alot of choice.  Hope they can do better.

I now know why its impossible to get in here without a reservation! Everything is top notch without breaking the bank! Service splended, flavours fabulous, atmosphere awesome! Words do not do the dishes justice!

Food was divine. As much hype as there was, its well deserved. The bento was a little disappointing. Udon was delicious. Rice bowl with soup was a great experience. The lunch menu was disappointing as well, it didnt feel its worth, but the sashimi was great. The staff were very accommodating. High chair and booster was available for kids. The portion of kids food is more than enough although half of it was raw cabbage; wasnt too appealing for the kid. Kid-friendliness: High chair and booster seat available. Although first come first serve as it seemed like only one was available each option.

This restaurant has consistently been amazing. Excellent service, high-quality dishes, fresh ingredients, all wrapped up in a beautiful restaurant setting. I never hesitate to recommend this gem of a Japanese restaurant. Bonus: they are so family-friendly and serve the best children s meal

We had a birthday dinner at Raisu. The first time we came here and really impressed with the food. We got the Wagyu set for 2 ppl, from the 1at bite the Wagyu was exceptional, the meat practically melted in my mouth. Also, the staff s attentiveness and genuine passion for providing unforgettable dining experience.

Patio alfresco dining and we have to take off our shoes. Restaurant is busy and we were given 2 hrs (1830-2030) to eat and vacate. Sashimi is fresh and service team is very polite. Wonder bday dinner celebration.

It was our sons birthday yesterday and we were surprised when the crew came with a birthday treat ,sang happy bday. They even took a photo of us and gave us the pict right after. The food was really great! We loved evrrything we ordered. Everyone was attentive to us diners. The table next to us, his chopsticks fell on the floor and within 2 seconds, the server was picking it up and supplied him with a replacement at the same time.  Impressive!  Will definitely come back!

Delightful Japanese Flavors in the Heart of the City Raisu is a special place where you can taste amazing Japanese food. They make really fresh and tasty meals that shows how skilled the chefs are. Youll also find yummy grilled dishes and comforting original Kobe wagyu beefs that make your taste buds happy. The people working there are super nice, and the place feels calm and cool. If you want to enjoy real Japanese food in a great atmosphere, this restaurant is the perfect spot for you.

The lunch deal was so worth it. The position size was good, I went hungry and left very full. I think you can get extra rice and miso soup too, so no worries there. With the lunch set, you can choose what you want from a few options which was pretty nice if you have any picky eaters. The bathroom was well stocked too, Mouthwash and glossers!
Came here a few times before for their uni special. This time I came for their new kobe wagu zankai menu! For the price it s definitely worth it! Friendly service and great food. Food : 5/5

Raisu is an incredible sushi place that have left speechless with their Otoro Deluxue Seafood Bowl. The fatty blue fin tuna sashimi just melts in your mouth! I also tried the sashimi platter that came with various selections of fish, and all of them is delicious! Staff are friendly and attentive! I highly recommend this place if you want to try the ultimate sushi experience in Vancouver.

Whenever I am in Vancouver, this is the first spot I go to for a delicious sushi meal. The sockeye salmon sashimi and one of the many lunch specials are absolutely delicious. Also a big fan of their unagi sushi. Always fresh and good portions. Excellent service.

We recently dined at Raisu, and the creamy uni udon was an absolute standout in my opinion. This dish was not only incredibly tasty but also, unique presentation in oversized bowl added a cool factor to the experience. The servers at Raisu were exceptionally sweet and attentive. If youre a fan of Japanese cuisine and looking for a memorable meal, Raisu is definitely worth a visit.
The food was excellent, we had a lunch special and it was very filling for the price. It also came with free miso soup refills! The service was great, and patio seating made for a fun time!

Exceptional service and quality of food. The staff clearly care a lot. Highly recommend their Seafood Chirashi Bowl (Or Unagi if you like that!), and some tasty appetizers I always get are chicken Karaage, Yuzu Cream Cheese Cubes and Takowasabi. Waits can be long during peak time so plan accordingly!

Excellent restaurant! Went on a Friday afternoon for an anniversary lunch. The staff there were very welcoming and friendly. They took the time to explain the menu and suggested what to order. We ordered an A5 wagyu beef udon and the 9 course appetizer set lunch. The udon was very flavorful and the beef melted in our mouths. The 9 appetizers were well coordinated to compliment each other. The miso soup was delicious too! After we finished our meal, the restaurant gave us a surprise. We got a complimentary dessert and the whole restaurant congratulated our anniversary. The waitresses also printed out an instax photo for us! Very nice experience.
We came here for lunch and everything was fantastic. Great food quality, awesome service. The $15 kid meal is amazing! Highly recommened! Kid-friendliness: The best Japanese kid meal

Highly recommend this restaurant - food was fresh and delicious (looked great too!) at a reasonable price, the decor made me feel like I was transported out of North America, and staff were friendly and attentive. Brought my friends here, and they thoroughly enjoyed their experience too!

Sho Ka Do bento was delicious and service was super friendly and welcoming! I booked a table through online and pre-ordered bento few days ago. It was my partners bday. They sang a bday song and took a Polaroid photo of us. It was unique experience for us and I will definitely visit again to try other menu

Words can not express how I feel. It was a mind-blowing culinary experience. The only thing I didnt like was the almond tofu desert. Its just a personal taste, because Im not a fan of ground cherries. The rest was fantastic. The servers are very hype and loud when they greet customers, it was funny and I loved it. They seem to really enjoy what they do. A special thanks and 5 stars to our server Igor. He was very  kind to help us in French choose the best dishes for our discovery menu. Well definitely come back  .

Raisu serves up delicious Japanese fare in a lively but cozy setting in the heart of Kits. You cannot go here and not order their fresh cut sashimi. Also highly recommend trying their Yuzu Cream Cheese as it s an underrated dish. Servers are wonderful and deliver every dish with a smile. Important* Expect to make a reservation if you plan on going past 6pm, otherwise go early as a walk in.

We actually made reservations here but had to cancel as our flight was delayed. We originally chose Raisu because their sister restaurant Kingyo was unavailable. Man, we are so happy that happened because while we love Kingyo, Raisu is even better! We may have lost our reservation, but we still end up coming for lunch before our flight home. I sadly missed out on their Sho Ka Do Bento as it was already sold out. Next time! We ordered the Vegetarian Udon for the kids. Wowza! Im no vegetarian, but the broth is amazing and rich. Plus, the portion size is bigger than we expected. I would eat it myself! We ordered the Yuzu Tuna Tataki, the Grilled Hamachikama Teishoku, the Mushroom Agedashi, and the Snow Crab and Ikura Hitsumabushi. Each dish was above expectations and shocked us with amazing flavors and portion sizes. The Yuzu Tuna Tataki was so fresh! The Grilled Hamachikama Teishoku was huge! The fish was so buttery soft. The Snow Crab and Ikura Hitsumabushi were perfectly flavored. I cant believe their stone bowl was even better than my favorite stone bowl from Kingyo. Finally, the Mushroom Agedashi was my wifes choice, but I love it too. Every single dish we ordered hit it out of the park! For dessert, my wife ordered Coffee Jelly. She loved it as well. Not one single failure. It was an amazing meal, and we already made another reservation already. Kid-friendliness: My kids love the Vegetarian Udon

Everything was delicious and service was super friendly and welcoming! Food didn t take long and also since it was my friend s bday they sang her a bday song and took a Polaroid photo of us to keep! (They even wrote a cute message on the Polaroid) Honestly gonna be back to try the rest of the menu!!!

Yum yum and yum... Every bite of this meal was an adventure where your palates will be your most trustworthy guide. Youll experience the freshness from the Pacific as you bite into the wild sockeye, how about taking a dip into the Atlantic as the fatty and flavorful salmon melts in your mouth? Perhaps you wanna balance these flavors with a tide of umami, from the savoury and hearty vegetable udon. Finally, to end this symphony of flavors, enjoy the chirashi as the grease from the lightly seared wagyu hugs around the tomago, binding the rice thats mixed with a variety of diced sashimi. Now thats a meal Id write home about

After a year of wanting to visit this place, finally my gf made a reservation for my birthday dinner. There were so many dishes we wanted to try but we had already made reservation for bento boxes. On top of the bento boxes, we were also planning on ordering spicy lobster cream udon but the server insisted that it would be too much for us. So, we ended up just getting two Sho Ka Do Bento boxes, which turned out to be amazing and made us very full at the end of the meal (thanks to the server who stopped us from blowing up our stomach). At the end of the meal, we were also treated with a complimentary desert to celebrate my birthday and a Polaroid picture for us to take home and remember! Very exceptional experience it was and we would definitely visit again to try that lobster udon that we have been craving.
The highlight of my BC trip! Incredibly fresh food with quick and efficient service. The Otoro bowl and kiwi punch were our favourites. Absolutely delicious and definitely a must visit.

Raisu is a place that my friends and I go to celebrate our birthdays because anyone can find something they like on their huge menu! There is so much to choose from. Prices reflect the quality of food that you get, and it is worth it! Service is always friendly. Be sure to make reservations for large groups because they are very busy!

The food here is AMAZING!! My wife and I are huge uni and sushi lovers and this place did not disappoint. We have so much fresh fish and skilled Japanese chef s at home in Hawaii and this place is now in our top 5! On top of that, the staff is extremely attentive and kind. Highly recommend coming here for delicious food and any occasion!

Excellent tasting food at good prices. You definitely need a reservation when you come here but if yo can snag one its totally worth it. We had the corn appetizer, the tuna tataki, and some entrees and all of them were great. Great place!
This place is amazing - food is just great and the service was top notch and very friendly - no reservation and sat at the bar and it was great big table - get the sake trey was really good

The food was amazing, we were seating on the terrasse but the interior was really nice, a lot of places are around the big bar and the ambiance with Japanese shouting when you enter and leave the place is fun too. Plates are not that expensive and quite big for the price.
The cozy atmosphere of the restaurant adds to the experience. Friendly chatter of fellow diners create a welcoming ambiance that makes you feel right at home.

I have tried many Japanese restaurants in yvr and I hope I know this place sooner.  The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The sushi and sashimi was fresh and flavorful, and the presentation was amazingly good. I also enjoyed the tonkatsu, which was juicy with a crispy crust. The service was excellent, and the staff was very attentive. They were quick to answer any questions I had, and they were more than happy to accommodate my dietary needs. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a great Japanese dining experience.

We came to Raisu to celebrate two birthdays. The service was good, and the food was delicious and fresh! We got the Uni Omakase dinner set for two people - the uni was fresh and delicious, and we were happy with the meal. We also ordered the Otoro Deluxe Seafood Bowl, Scallop Sashimi, Tonkatsu, Spicy Lobster Uni Udon, and some aburi sushi. The udon looks small in pictures, but that s because they give you a huge bowl. The udon was very tasty and flavorful with the lobster! They also brought out a complimentary dessert for the birthday people, and took a Polaroid picture of our table. We were very impressed with the flavors and how fresh the seafood was, and we ll definitely be coming back!

Some unique offerings and quite tasty food. Pretty good atmosphere and liked the veranda seating. Seasoning on food was well adjusted. Personal favorite was the Sea Urchin Donabe Rice. It would be nice to return and try more.

A completely astonishing diner! The food was delectable and mouth-watering. The finest eats were the Seafood Bowl and the Omakase Aburi Sushi  , which were absolutely flawless. The staff was very friendly and sociable. The most memorable thing was when the staff all came around and sang my friend a happy birthday. They also gave us a cake  . The best Japanese restaurant Ive ever been to. Dietary restrictions: If you have any allergies, inform the waiter. Parking: At around noon, there was a fair quantity of parking. $2 per hour

I found another fancy place for date, and special anniversary. I also liked that they had many different flavors of sake. I tried the house special sake which was on the first line of the sake menu, it was easy drinking, and kind of fruity taste. I loved it. I would recommend the robster cream udon, and chirsashi don. The cream uden was so flavorful, and super creamy. Also, the seafoods on the top of chirashi don were rich and fresh. For feedback, in my personal opinion, I really didnt enjoy the seaweed with tuna sashimi which came with in the bento box. I thought that the seaweek taste was pretty strong, so it kind of hid the flavor of tuna sashimi. Overall, the foods were so fresh and delicious. The servers there were nice and friendly. The atmosphere was cozy inside, and the tables outside is really nice, too.

The BEST uni cream udon I ve ever had. Not heavy at all, more like a soup consistency. The otoro sashimi is amazing. And a nice different take on the agedashi tofu. Can t wait to go back and try their uni dishes, they were out today.

Back in 2021 we dined in and had amazing experience. The 9 section bento had to be pre ordered at least a day in advance and definitely recommend making a reservation in advance. Last week we visited Vancouver again and ordered Uber to deliver to airbnb and again the food was great! But I believe dining in the sashimi would be better as it won t get warmed up by the rice underneath. The creamy Uni and crabmeat udon was delicious and the mushroom agetofu was still very yummy when I microwaved it the next day as i got too full.
One of the best japanese restaurants I have been. Sushi very fresh. The hot plates are very good and delicious.  Little expensive but Its okay . Service is attentive and very fast.

Had the uni omakase and it was a wonderful experience. All the food was made exceptionally well. They also asked us for the occasion and provided a complementary cake.  They did not cheap out with the Polaroid film as it was the big wide ones.  The staff personally decorated our photo.  I know the extra might seem very small but it really adds onto the whole experience. Will definitely come back to try their other menu.

The veggie and seasoned bento are extremely recommend. Especially the veggie. They must be reserved for 24 hours before. The Toro sashimi are recommended, very authentic Japanese food Very fun experience. Take off shoes before enter the table. Open area and its on the 2nd floor. Very refreshing. Maybe windy for some people. Omosaka for two, Umi not Good as I expected.umi mixed with toro are great, but The wagyu beef mixed with Umi it does not combine by well, I throw up afterwards. The udon is recommended. But the portions are small. The first time is the charm but for the second time, The surprise is gone. Overall some of the food that has sauce is overwhelming and off balance. Other than the sauce, the food quality except for Umi, are excellent. I will come again for The sashimi bowl. Vegetarian options: Highly recommend it Parking: No free parking, pay parking on the side roll or across the street. The Safeway pay parking

One of the must try when you visit Vancouver! The sashimi taste really fresh & have the best presentation I have ever seen    the staff were very professional and attentive which I greatly appreciated! It s worth to mention that their drinks menu is really interesting. We ordered their sake which paired really well with our food! The restaurant s atmosphere was relaxing & cozy!    we ll definitely come back to this restaurant!
Super authentic Japanese cuisine they serve here! The taste and the texture of the dishes are excellent as the ingredients are fresh. The staffs are also friendly and the dining experience was great.
Love this authentic Japanese restaurant. This will be our go to place for Japanese food.  Although its not cheap, you get what you pay for on taste, services and atmosphere.
Been visiting here from time to time and they never disappoint! Food, drinks, omakase, and service are top notch. You really can t go wrong with any order. Highly highly recommend :)

Raisu has been around forever and the quality is always good. We went for a birthday and it seemed like there were 5 other parties celebrating birthdays on the same night. Order the Snow Crab and Uni Cream Udon. They take a polaroid photo for birthdays too which is a nice touch.

Overall great food + best service. Raisu never disappoints. Best if your seated in the bar (usually walk ins get seated in bar) Bento box never disappoints. You get a choice of 2 proteins (3 sashimi, meat dish, grilled fish or 2 kinds of fried food) The lobster udon is everyone s favourite tho in pricey side. Everything in the menu is great!

This is a great place to make memories. Food is always great and the value for the quality and preparation of the food is bar none. I make it a mission to eat here on special days(birthdays, anniversaries, etc) The staff was friendly and attentive. If you get a chance to visit the set menu provides a great experience with very little thought. Never once did I go wrong getting the chefs choice! Also if your a big drinker the ponzu cocktails give a nice twist to your average mojito. 5 stars would give a bonus 6 if I could

We had more food than this I just forgot to take pictures. Everything was so delicious! I ordered blue fin tuna sashimi and that was amazing! We were there for my cousins birthday, there was like 15 of us and everyone enjoyed themselves! We shared food as well and everything was so good! If it wasnt so far away from where I lived I would go there quite often! However the food is not cheap as it is quality stuff you are eating! Kid-friendliness: They have a kids menu which is totally worth it!

The deluxe seafood bowl and bento box are cheap and delicious. Sashimi was really fresh and sauce was tasting. Wonderful experience with excellent serving. The cake and our picture was really a surprise.

AMAZING!!! The restaurant was nicely decorated so the atmosphere was very impressive right when you enter. The staff were also friendly but the food was the highlight. I recommend the crab and uni cream udon, it was super delicious and we couldn t stop eating it from the first bite. Make sure to make a reservation because they get very busy. Also note the bento could be reserved as they only have limited quality each day. We will definitely come back!

Do yourself a favor and visit this lovely restaurant in Downtown. The service is unmatched. The staff truly cares about your experience. They know what they re doing and what they re talking about, and you can tell making the customers happy is their main priority. Food is absolutely amazing   everything we tasted melted in our mouths. Absolutely the best meal we had while in Downtown. Definitely fine dining. It can be expensive but worth it. Highly recommend!

The freshest sashimi I ve ever had in North America! All the food were very aesthetically pleasing (for all you foodies out there!) The yuzu cream cheese was one of the most unique item from their menu.

Our experience at Raisu was terrific! I found this restaurant through google, and all the positive reviews made me book it for my boyfriends birthday. And let me tell you, all these reviews are genuine! We chose the KAISEKI course for two; the food was excellent and fresh. That was more than enough for just two of us. And at the end of our dinner, they showed up with a beautiful cake and surprised my boyfriend. I need to mention that they took a photo with a polaroid camera from us and gave it to us before leaving, which made the night 100% more memorable. If I could, I would give them more than five stars. They made our night!

Unique and high quality options for sushi and other Japanese dishes. The Otoro bowl is over the top and delicious. If you haven t been here before, try the Sho Ka Do Bento to sample most of their appetizers. Large portions here meant for sharing.
Food is always consistently good. Service is great. Amazing Tonkatsu

Great experience here. - Friendly staff - unique food - presentation is great - great place to celebrate special occasions - we recommend the sashimi, octopus in Wasabi, & waygu. - skip the uni udon - environment is clean and beautifully decorated. Patio is beautiful!!

This restaurant worths a 5 star!! One of the best Japanese restaurants I ve tried at Vancouver at the moment. The service is super good, I love the smiles on the waitresses & waiters The food is delicious and fresh. Ordered Deluxe Seafood Bowl. I love the rice very much. For seafood, too much salmon but still ok. Environment, the interior of the restaurant is clean and Japanese style. It is walking distance to English Bay. Highly recommend you make a reservation before you go, as otherwise, you might need to queue

Would return, would recommend. Bustling, high energy modern Japanese food let down by staffing/service attention. If they are sold out of their specials, they should let people in line waiting know, and they should not be giving those menus out. We lucked out as no one bought their special bento that night - everyone feeding on Ootoro, so we got it instead. I highly highly recommend this path - extremely worth it in terms of quality of items, taste and portion. The meatball in this bento was so amazing - I literally cannot describe it other than pure concentrated beef flavour. Please, please try this out. The Truffle Uni shooter, equally amazing. I would go as far to say this quality and taste of food was than the $200pp omakases floating around town. All for $34. The chefs pressed sushi is not worth it and not that great. Pretty par - skip this. Agedashi Tofu was interesting - very tasty, good portions but didnt like the cornstarch thickened agedashi broth. Truffle Uni shooter is amazing, must have (dont share it!). Uni egg custard is tasty - worth trying but skippable. Snow crab on eggs is a definite skip - the bento contained more snow crab and didnt offer anything special. Takes AMEX, make sure you book as the lines are long. It was still very busy around 8pm, and they sell out of specials around this time.

Part of the wonderful Kingyo group of restaurants, this location does not disappoint. The Sho Ka Do Bento is a must-try but is limited in quantity so call ahead to reserve one. Friendly and attentive service. Recommended! Kid-friendliness: Kids menu offered here.

Second time coming here. Good quality of food and amazing service! The restaurant charged me incorrectly. I sent an email on the next day, and they checked my bill. After recognizing they made a mistake, they called me back to apologize and process a refund to my credit card immediately.

Great food, great service! We went with the Kaiseki Course containing of 7-9 dishes depending if you go with the extra 2 dishes that you ll have to pay additional fees for. We went with sashimi salad for our first choice of salad. Then the sashimi & deep fried for our choice of two appetizers. Then also added the wagyu nigiri sushi ($24 for 2). Then our Choice of carb was the lobster uni cream udon. All the food was good, but by the time we got to our carb dish we were pretty stuffed. My personal favourites out of all the dishes were the Sashimi, otoro aburi sushi, and the wagyu nigiri, then finishing with the matcha creme brulee cake.

Pictured: Wagyu Udon Stylish take on Japanese food. This restaurant family has become a highlight of approachable  Vancouver Japanese dining. Looking forward to checking out their curry katsu restaurant.

Absolutely stunning presentation and delicious food. As you can see, the lobster udon was in a comically large bowl. This was just part of the fun. The lobster was conveniently peeled and placed outside of the shell, juicy and cooked to perfection. Udon noodles were handmade and had the perfect chewiness to them. Broth was creamy and flavourful. The plum wine sangria was refreshing, full of crunchy fresh fruit. Highlight of the meal was the wagyu nigiri-the touch of truffle salt really elevated the flavour profile of this dish. Decor and atmosphere was bright and aesthetically pleasing. The only area of improvement would be the speed of service. We were waiting quite a while to get our orders taken and bills at the end of the meal. We did notice the server appeared to have someone shadowing them, so leniency was given due to this. Otherwise, an overall pleasant experience! Highly recommend!

Raisu has friendly good service and absolutely fresh delectable food. My little one loved the kids meal as it comes with a variety of food. Although the food is on the pricier side but it is well worth it as the quality and taste is top notch. I feel the best value is with their lunch combo or shokado bento where you can sample different taste and foods. If you want to splurge a little go for the uni course or their otoro blue fin tuna deluxe seafood bowl both are absolutely amazing.

Best birthday ever. Thank you Raisu! I visited here in September, and it is as wonderful as I remember. The atmosphere is bubbly and spacious, the food is phenomenal (unlike anywhere in the city), the place is wholesome and friendly, it makes me feel that Im back in Japan. I havent celebrated my birthday in five years so it was time, they went above and beyond with sake choices, singing me happy birthday with a complimentary dessert. Everyone who works at Raisu is a genuine joy and I cant wait to return. Thank you Raisu, nobody has taken my photograph on my birthday for seven years, the polaroid means the world to me

I cant recommend this place enough for any special occasion or even a casual night out. The combination of fresh and delicious food, great service, and a cozy atmosphere creates an unforgettable dining experience. What truly made celebrating a birthday with Raisu extraordinary was the personalized touch from the staff. They give you a cute photo souvenir of your party and provide a dessert of the house. 10/10

Food is delicious and super fresh!! Its been a year since Ive last visited and the food quality is still amazing. Service was friendly and attentive. I highly recommend their fois gras and wagyu nigiri.  Honestly, just try everything off their menu (different things every visit) and take advantage of tgeir special set menus- its fun and wont disappoint. I had their holiday menu for 2  It was a lot more food than I thought. Atmosphere is very cozy and loud with the music and energy from the staff. Loved the bar countertop experience! Original review: Went for the first time to celebrate my anniversary and loved it. Food was so fresh and super delicious. My favorite is the Milky Silky Mentaiko udon, wagyu and the uni   I was super excited for the otoro blue fin deluxe bowl, but found that a bit chewier than I expected (tendons? I dont know). Great service! Would definitely go again - actually , need to go again to try everything on the menu ..!

Recommend making a reservation here. If you didnt make a reservation then be sure to go early they usually have bar seats available. Food is very good and portions are quite big, maybe thats why they can charge the price they charge. They also have a very good selection of sake as well.  I would definitely go back.

Loooooove everything we tried on the menu! And boy did we try to taste everything on the menu. Generous portions that s super tasty and beautifully presented. We were lucky to catch the uni omakase while it was still available. $135 for 6 courses for 2 people!!! How do you say no to that!

The blue-fin tuna sashimis are as fatty as described in the menu, and the scallops and spot prawns are fresh and delicious too. The two types of fish in the lunch set are also tasty. Cozy environment and excellent service. We got a surprise almond tofu for our anniversary after our meal too! So sweet!

One of my favourite restaurants in the city. Excellent atmosphere! Their playlist is pretty good, waitresses are super friendly and attentive. The dishes were rich in flavour and each one was presented uniquely. It was overall a very pleasant experience.

We drove from Seattle to have lunch and we re not disappointed! I was able to get one of the daily bento boxes. There are only a limited number available each day and generally you need to reserve in advance. I d happily drive up again for another lunch at Rausu. Vegetarian options: Several vegetarian options available.
We always come here once in a while to splurge during a special occasion. The food is always awesome. Recommend to reserve your table well in advance.

Just incredible. The sushi rice is perfectly seasoned. Not an undercooked/overcooked grain in the bowl. The chirashi-don is jam packed with the oceans bounty. The otoro just melted in my mouth. So fresh. Top shelf ingredients. Fantastic service.

One of the best Japanese restaurants in Vancouver. Good selection on their a la cart and set menus. They do run on the pricier side, but I say its worth the quality. Good place for a nice date night. Also, theyre following public health protocols well with take out/delivery and outdoor patio. The uni (sea urchin) is fresh and amazing, anyone looking to try it for the first time this is the place to go! My first uni experience was at another restaurant and honestly it was terrible and ruined my perception of it, until I tried Raisu. It was amazing and I was completely blown away. They have a set menu for Uni for lunch currently but normally is set for dinner.
Always good time at Raisu! Our server Ai was very welcoming and super friendly! First time tried their Bento box   All 9 different kinds of food were very tasty!! Definitely recommend to try it!!
I went here for my birthday! Great set menu perfectly full, with a great variety of food. I highly recommend this place. Authentic Japanese food.

Great food with reasonable pricing. Service here was also really nice and kind. Type of service that is tentative but not overwhelming or excessive. Look of the restaurant is also really nice. Its kind of open space, industrial feel, and kind of a traditional feel at the same time.. not sure if the explanation help but its a really good mix. Not wheelchair friendly though. To get there you have to walk up the stairs. And if u want an balcony table seat you have to request for it when making a reservation. Should make a reservation if u plan on going I would definitely come back here again.

Authentic upscale Japanese food. Went for lunch and really enjoyed the lunch set with grilled fish (salmon and mackerel) and sashimi. Nabeyaki udon had fresh wagyu beef and Don katsu was excellent too. Lively and busy ambience. They have patio seating for bigger groups - reservations are mandatory!

Great service! Delicious food! The uni was all very fresh and sweet. We ordered the uni set and it came a bit slowly so by the time the dessert came we had to pay our bill and leave 15 minutes later because the next group arrived. But otherwise it was great!

Ive been in Vancouver my whole life and I was extremely sad I only came to this restaurant for the first time recently.  I wish I came sooner!  The food was amazing and top notch quality.  The atmosphere was a lot different than I imagined, in a good way.  Its a very casual place, which I love.  The food is very elevated and tasted amazing.  They have some unique dishes you wouldnt find in typical Japanese restaurants.  Would come here again in a heartbeat

This is the first time I try this restaurant, during the lunch hour, it s not very busy but the patio is full already. The hostess & the waitress is very polite, and friendly too. I ordered the deluxe seafood bowl, it s come with the mushroom miso soup, very traditional taste, not too salty. Also, the waitress explained every seafood in the bowl, very professional. The presentation & the taste is very nice, no fishy smell. Of course, it s fresh too, no complaint. Highly recommend. The second time lunch again in this restaurant, I ordered the otoro deluxe seafood bowl, it s so good, the tuna is fat enough to melt in your mouth, no complaint again.

Easy to say this is one of my favorite place to eat out. Their combination of the food is by far ranked at the top. Food portion, food quality, the taste, service, and after desserts are close to perfect. The employees are very welcoming and the Japanese style warmed-seats are suitable for winter time.
